long: Meaning: properly, to "eye" or (generally) to "heed", i.e. "pay attention"; by implication, to "respond"; by extension to "begin to speak"; specifically to "sing", "shout", "testify", "announce".  Usage: give account, afflict (by mistake for "H6031"), (cause to, give) answer, bring low (by mistake for "H6031"), cry, hear, lift up, say, Ã— scholar, (give a) shout, sing (together by course), speak, testify, utter, (bear) witness. See also "H1042", "H1043".  Source: a primitive root;
